content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle, easy to understand, so perfect for a clash :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quick funny clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash, great for Speed and Reverse. Maybe not for Size as string handling can be significantly shorter depending on the language used.

This problem was really enjoyable for me! I liked how it required both logical thinking and creativity to visualize the bookshelf. The combination of handling input and designing the structure using | and - to represent books made the task feel engaging. It was a nice balance between simplicity and challenge, and I had fun figuring out how to properly format the output. The constraints were just right, making it a rewarding experience without being too overwhelming.

Good Clash. Loved it. Just the perfect difficulty for Clash of code, also can be played in all the three formats. Solved in less than 4 minutes in Python and pretty sure it will take similar amount of time for other languages too, so even better for fastest mode.

This is a wonderful problem and I enjoyed solving it, but I feel like it may be a little too hard for a Clash of Code. I wasn't able to solve it in less than 10 minutes although it would have gone faster in Python. I think it would be perfect difficulty for a Clash (on the hard side) if all the books were the same width. It's also great as-is for an easy puzzle. Just my 2c, as someone who has been playing Clashes for a few months, I could be wrong.

Input
* Please format "N" (in "Next N lines") as a [[variable]].

* Please add "Two space-separated integers" before "H, W".

* Please change "width and height" to "height and thickness" for (a) consistency in wording and (b) the order of the variables in the stub generator.

Stub generator
* Line 2: Please change to:
loop N read H:int W:int

* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.

I am glad that you enjoyed it!
I also found it a little too hard for Clash of Code. It is a good idea to make it an easy puzzle. I also consider an easier version of it for Clash of Code.
Thank you!
